programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Luck: After making a fool of himself in front of she-bear, Grizzy finds a four-leaf clover which seems to bring him good luck. Could his chance be changing? (S1 Ep20)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Magnetic Bear: Grizzy can't believe his eyes when he sees objects moving all by themselves, but it's the lemmings who are playing around. (S1 Ep21)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Teleportation's the Way to Go!: Grizzy finds two identical vases in a Native American Indian chest. If he sticks his hand in one, it comes out the other! (S1 Ep33)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Relax Bear: Grizzy discovers with that the ranger has purchased a new recliner. But even an armchair designed for relaxation can be used for other purposes by the Lemmings! (S1 Ep36)

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Caroline Munro wraps up a petrifying evening and gives us a taster of next week's extraordinary sci-fi horrors. [S]

programme.title: The Woman Eater
programme.desc: 1958. Sci-Fi. Directed By Charles Saunders. Stars George Coulouris & Vera Day. A mad scientist captures women and feeds them to a flesh eating tree. [S]

programme.title: Life In Emergency Ward 10
programme.desc: 1959. Drama. Based on the smash hit TV series about the daily life and the ups and downs of a hospital. Stars Michael Craig, Wilfred Hyde-White and Joan Sims. [S]

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: Jed Rescues Pearl. 1962. Stars Max Baer Jr., Bea Benaderet & Elvia Allman. The Clampetts are missing their Beverly Hills mansion, but Jed says they have to stay until Pearl wins over Mr. Brewster. [S]

programme.title: Stagecoach West
programme.desc: The Land Beyond. Western starring Wayne Rogers, Richard Eyer & Robert Bray. Luke & Simon foil a gunman who provokes a passenger on their stagecoach run and the vicious gunslinger tracks the stage. [S]

programme.title: Tread Softly
programme.desc: 1952. Crime. Directed by David MacDonald. Stars Frances Day, Patricia Dainton & John Bentley. The star of a musical walks out before curtain up, but the show must go on, in a 'Haunted Theatre'. [S]

programme.title: There Was a Young Lady
programme.desc: 1953. Comedy. Director: Lawrence Huntington. Stars Michael Denison, Dulcie Gray & Sydney Tafler. A diamond merchants' secretary gets fired by her new boss for being too efficient. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life The Big Sell
programme.desc: 1968. A look at how British weeks are planned in cities abroad to help promote trade.

programme.title: The Fabulous Dorseys
programme.desc: 1947. Musical. Tommy and Jimmy Dorsey play themselves in this rise and rise story of the fabulous Dorsey brothers. [S]

programme.title: Captain Pirate
programme.desc: 1952. Adventure. Directed by Ralph Murphy. Stars Louis Hayward, Patricia Medina & John Sutton. A retired buccaneer is forced back onto the high seas to escape execution and clear his good name. [S]

programme.title: The Brothers
programme.desc: Public Concern. 1974. Stars Jean Anderson, John Baddeley & Colin Baker. A local petition, protesting about Hammond's lorries, threatens the company's plans to go public. [S]

programme.title: Return of the Texan
programme.desc: 1952. Western. Directed by Delmer Daves. Stars Dale Robertson, Joanne Dru & Walter Brennan. A widower returns to his hometown with his grandfather and two sons to make a go of the old family farm. [S]

programme.title: A Town Like Alice
programme.desc: 1956. Drama. Directed by Jack Lee. Stars Virginia McKenna, Peter Finch & Kenji Takaki. While suffering the hardships of being a prisoner of war, Jean meets and befriends captive Australian Joe. [S]

programme.title: Z-Cars
programme.desc: Ringers. 1976. Stars George Baizley, Antony Carrick, Todd Carty, John Collin & Rosalind Elliot. In detection you need routine and instinct. But not necessarily in that order. [S]

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: Intent to Steal. 1970. Stars Alfred Lynch, Peter Barkworth & Peter Welch. Jimmy and Vincent lead a daring raid of the German-controlled metalworks to steal a valuable aircraft component. [S]

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Maigret Sees Double. 1999. Stars Bruno Cremer, Laure Duthilleul & Aladin Reibel. Maigret investigates the death of an ordinary accountant and discovers surprising information along the way. [S]

programme.title: An Affair in Mind
programme.desc: 1988. Crime Drama. Directed by Colin Luke. Stars Amanda Donohoe, Stephen Dillane & Hilary Mason. A young novelist falls for a married woman, who then wants him to kill her husband. [S]

programme.title: The Secret of Seagull Island
programme.desc: 1982. Drama. Directed by Nestore Ungaro. Stars Jeremy Brett, Prunella Ransome & Nicky Henson. In Rome, a woman embarks on a chilling journey to find her blind sister who mysteriously disappeared.

programme.title: The Secret of Seagull Island
programme.desc: 1982. Drama. Directed by Nestore Ungaro. Stars Jeremy Brett, Prunella Ransome & Nicky Henson. In Rome, a woman embarks on a chilling journey to find her blind sister who mysteriously disappeared.

programme.title: Patterns
programme.desc: 1956. Drama. Directed by Fielder Cook. Stars Van Heflin, Everett Sloane & Ed Begley. Fred Staples finds his ambitions and ethics at odds after being employed by a renowned New York corporation. [S]

programme.title: The Voice Within
programme.desc: 1946. Crime. Directors Isadore Goldsmith & Maurice J. Wilson. Stars Kieron Moore & Barbara White. A young man joins a gang of smugglers but runs into trouble after accidently killing a policeman. [S]

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The Case of Harry Crocker. 1954. Starring: Ronald Howard, Howard Marion-Crawford & Archie Duncan. Escape artist Harry Crocker turns to Sherlock Holmes when he is accused of strangling a girl. [S]

programme.title: Once In a New Moon
programme.desc: 1935. Sci-Fi. Stars Eliot Makeham, Rene Ray & Derrick de Marney. A small town gets dragged out into space and the populace try to organise a local government based on equal rights for all. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life The City's for Living In
programme.desc: 1968. A response to the Buchanan Report, with a focus on Bath and Norwich, as to how British towns and cities are dealing with the impact of traffic on the environment.

programme.title: Come Back Peter
programme.desc: 1952. Comedy. Director: Charles Saunders. Stars Patrick Holt, Peter Hammond, Humphrey Lestocq & Kathleen Boutall. Pandemonium is created in a home when various relatives come to stay. [S]

programme.title: Subway in the Sky
programme.desc: 1959. Drama. Directed by Muriel Box. Starring Hildegard Knef, Katherine Kath & Van Johnson. A military doctor is falsely accused of dealing illegal drugs. Can he prove his innocence? [S]

programme.title: Gallant Journey
programme.desc: 1946. Drama. Directed by William A. Wellman. Stars Glenn Ford, Janet Blair & Charlie Ruggles. Biopic of US aviation pioneer John J. Montgomery who battled the odds to build a successful glider. [S]

programme.title: Suspected Person
programme.desc: 1942. Drama. Director: Lawrence Huntington. Stars Clifford Evans, Patricia Roc, David Farrar, Robert Beatty, William Hartnell. Two bank robbers try to find their partner, who fled to London. [S]

programme.title: The Pretty Things On Film
programme.desc: 1966. An incredible promotional short for the English rock band The Pretty Things.

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: No Smoke Without Fire - Part 1. 1973. Stars Barry Jackson & Derek Waring. Mr Bennington is charged with causing arson at the home of his estranged wife's boss, publisher Jeremy Clements. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: No Smoke Without Fire - Part 2. 1973. Stars Maria Aitken, Mollie Maureen. Edward's former wife gives evidence, and Nellie Kent tells of a telephone call she overheard on the night of the fire. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: No Smoke Without Fire - Part 3. 1973. Stars John Bailey & Sarah Lawson. Edward's brother Donald attempts to explain his erratic behaviour and Mrs. Clements takes to the stand to give evidence. [S]

programme.title: Notorious (1946)
programme.desc: 1946. Drama. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock. Stars Cary Grant, Ingrid Bergman & Claude Rains. A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America, but how far will she have to go? [S]

programme.title: Holiday All The Way
programme.desc: A charming travelogue of coach tours available throughout the UK and on the continent in the 50s/60s.

programme.title: Those British Faces
programme.desc: 1993. Documentary series that acts as a tribute to the greats of British cinema. This episode looks at the great Alastair Sim, narrated by Richard Todd. [S]

programme.title: The Cheaters
programme.desc: The Man Who Wouldn't Be Paid. 1961. Stars John Ireland & Ian Fleming. Benjamin Clarke buys a rare book for a fraction of its real worth and puts himself at the mercy of his gold-digging family. [S]

programme.title: The Brothers
programme.desc: The Mole. 1976. Stars Richard Easton, Robin Chadwick & Clive Swift. Griffith Trevelyan, Chief Sales Executive of RAI Transport, decides to play games with the rival companies bidding for his firm. [S]

programme.title: Travelling Man
programme.desc: Sudden Death. 1984. Stars Leigh Lawson, Colin Jeavons, Tony Doyle. Lomax returns to London for his mother's funeral. Afterwards, he targets Pember - a man who might be able to help clear his name. [S]

programme.title: The Gold Robbers

programme.title: The Nudist Story
programme.desc: 1960. Drama. Director: Ramsey Herrington. Stars Shelley Martin, Brian Cobby, Natalie Lynn. A woman is horrified when she inherits a nudist camp but her views are challenged when she falls in love. [S]
